description: Change of use from hostel (sui generis) to Class 4 (Houses in multiple occupation) including part single storey; part two storey rear extensions with a total of 48 rooms with 58 people; hard standing patio area to rear; replacement of hard standing area to front; landscaping; bicycle storage and side wall at front of properties.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with : -	Proposed ground floor plan, P301, Rev. A, 18.11.15 -	Proposed first floor plan, P302, Rev. A, 18.11.15 -	Proposed second floor plan, P303, Rev. A, 18.11.15 -	Proposed elevations, P402, Rev. A, 18.11.15 -	Proposed roof plan, P304, Rev. A, 18.11.15 -	Proposed Ground floor plan, P105, Rev. A, 18.11.15   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 1.1(h) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2015) and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013. | The bicycle storage facility (secure, undercover and lockable) shall be setback from the side boundary 1m and enlarged to  accommodate 29 bicycles, with details submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved. The details shall be implemented as approved.  Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 the London Plan 2015. | The composite sound insulation of the building envelope and internal partitions shall achieve an acoustic standard for internal levels of not greater than 30 dB LAeq,1hr inside the rooms with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided.   Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2015), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The development shall be equipped with a system to provide fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms on the Hanger Lane facade, the supply to be provided from the rear of the building at high level. The system shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied and permanently retained in a working order.  Reason: To ensure that the development accords with policy 7.14 of the London Plan 2015; policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The installation in each dwelling of an Ultra-Low NOx boiler with maximum NOx Emissions of under 40 mg/kWh, shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained.   Reason: To minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015; the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG; policies 1.1(e) and (j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | No occupation shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local  Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by theLocal Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2015. | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
